result.execSummary:
The defendant Ottez Mitchell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ottez Mitchell is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ottez Mitchell was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  DDA Graveley appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Michel.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 5yrs 6mos WSP; initial confinement of 30mos followed by 3yrs of ES.  See ES conditions.  Credit for 18 days.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgment.  Bond shall be applied towards financial obligations.  Balance may be returned to poster.
Sentencing hearing on April 7, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Amended

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  DDA Graveley appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Wm. Michel.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Amended information filed.  Deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 3/18/16 @ 10am.
Per email from Atty Michel - case is resolved; remove FPT for 1/28/16.  Plea on 2/1/16 @ 2pm

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  DDA Graveley appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Wm. Michel.  New offer just relayed today.  Defense counsel requests add'l time to review this offer w/his client.  Another FPT set for 1/28/16 @ 1pm.
State's List of Witnesses and Demand for Discovery - filed by ADA, Michael Graveley  kmk

Minutes:  15CF717/15CF718.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  DDA Graveley appeared for the State.  Deft Mitchell appeared in person w/Atty Michel.  Deft Denton appeared in person w/Atty Carl Johnson.  Atty Johnson reports he is still waiting for medical reports - should be received sometime next week.  Atty Johnson requests an adjournment of the present JS date since he has a homicide trial next week and will not have sufficient time to review the docs prior to 11/16/15.  Atty Michel reports he is requesting testing of the casings found at the scene.  Before the court will sign an order for the testing of these casings, Atty Michel will need to provide documentation from a 3rd party of the probability of there being any detectable and identifiable DNA on the casings.  DDA Graveley reports a court order is needed to have the casings tested.  State has no objection to defense's adjournment request.  FPT 1/21/16 @ 11am, JS 2/1/16 @ 9am.
